snippet: The court agreed to decide whether Arizona may require proof of citizenship in order to register to vote in federal elections.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to decide whether Arizona may require proof of citizenship, like birth certificates or passports, in order to register to vote in federal elections; federal appeals court blocked state law in April, saying it conflicted with National Voter Registration Act of 1993, which  allows voters to swear they are citizens under penalty of perjury.
lead_paragraph: The court agreed to decide whether Arizona may require proof of citizenship in order to register to vote in federal elections.

headline.seo: Supreme Court to Hear Case on Arizona Voter Registration
headline.main: Justices to Review Voter Law in Arizona
headline.print_headline: Justices To Review Voter Law In Arizona
